title: Should Jamie Oliver be holding baby so close to cooker?
text: comments Frying some food with one hand while cradling his baby in the other, Jamie Oliver looks like the king of multi-tasking. But in the eyes of parenting experts, and many of his fans, this is a hazard warning rather than an adorable photo. The celebrity chef has been criticised for holding his six-month-old son River Rocket while cooking, with many people claiming that the baby is at risk of being scolded by fat. Parenting expert Sue Atkins cautioned: ‘It’s a cute picture but underneath it there are some dangers. What if the pan suddenly started spitting?’ The celebrity chef has been criticised for holding his six-month-old son River Rocket while cooking, with many people claiming that the baby is at risk of being scolded by fat One worried fan warned the father-of-five: ‘I once had an awful experience doing just that with my little girl.’ Another said: ‘So adorable. But PLEASE don’t hold your baby near the stove’, while a third branded the chef ‘irresponsible’. However, many praised him for looking so relaxed, and said that he has experience of raising children and should be free from criticism. Oliver did not seem worried by the situation, and looked entirely at ease as he rested River on his hip while getting on with the cooking. He captioned the photograph, which was posted on social media: ‘Gotta start them young! bless baby River he’s so fascinated by the cooking.’ RELATED ARTICLES
